CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: As a result , the solar cell device fabricated from the blend of the copolymer and PC71BM exhibits a promising power conversion efficiency of 7.02% ( V OC = 0.80 V , J SC = 13.1 mA cm^-2 , FF = 0.67 ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| the blend of the copolymer and PC71BM |
| the copolymer |
| PC71BM |

The three "Material Name" entities identified in the paragraph are "the blend of the copolymer and PC71BM", "the copolymer", and "PC71BM". These entities are materials used in the fabrication of the solar cell device.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| the blend of the copolymer and PC71BM |

After reviewing the previous answer, I realized that only one entity in the list clearly refers to a "Material Name". The entity "the blend of the copolymer and PC71BM" is a material made from a mixture of the copolymer and PC71BM. The other two entities, "the copolymer" and "PC71BM", are not explicitly mentioned as materials in the paragraph, but they are implied to be materials since they are used in the fabrication of the solar cell device. Therefore, I have removed the two implied entities and kept only the explicit one in the final answer.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: As a result , the solar cell device fabricated from the blend of the copolymer and PC71BM exhibits a promising power conversion efficiency of 7.02% ( V OC = 0.80 V , J SC = 13.1 mA cm^-2 , FF = 0.67 ).

Let's think step by step.

Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph presented as a Markdown table:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| power conversion efficiency |
| V<sub>OC</sub> |
| J<sub>SC</sub> |
| FF |

Note: In the original paragraph, V<sub>OC</sub>, J<sub>SC</sub>, and FF are presented with subscripts, so I have preserved this formatting in the table. These abbreviations likely stand for "open-circuit voltage," "short-circuit current density," and "fill factor," respectively, which are common parameters used to evaluate the performance of solar cells.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| V<sub>OC</sub> |
| J<sub>SC</sub> |
| FF |

Note: In the original paragraph, V<sub>OC</sub>, J<sub>SC</sub>, and FF are presented with subscripts, so I have preserved this formatting in the table. These abbreviations likely stand for "open-circuit voltage," "short-circuit current density," and "fill factor," respectively, which are common parameters used to evaluate the performance of solar cells.
